explanation: Philip claims he stayed at Murphy's Pub watching football from 7 PM until closing at midnight. But Clue 2 reveals the bartender saw Philip leave abruptly around 11 PM saying he forgot something at work. Clue 1 shows the building alarm was disarmed at 11:48 PM using Philip's personal staff code, and Clue 3 confirms the pub is only six minutes from the auction house -- giving him plenty of time. Philip left the pub, returned to the auction house, opened the display safe, swapped the real cameo for the replica, and reset the alarm.
funFact: Victorian shell cameos carved from conch shells were so popular that Naples alone employed over 12,000 cameo carvers in the 1850s, making fakes nearly as old as the originals.
